page.title: 09Tourism in Elton/ Birchover
page.content: The area is visited by holiday makers and day visitors. There are footpaths for the walker (23 in Elton parish alone) providing varied scenery and good long distance views. The gritstone outcrops of Robin Hoods Stride and Cratcliffe are used by rock climbers and there is much to interest the bird watcher and naturalist. Ski- ing and tobogganing take place after Winter snowfalls. A few houses provide bed & breakfast accommodation and there are two camp sites. There is a self-catering Youth Hostel at Elton. In addition there are seventeen furnished cottages available for holiday letting. The Druid Inn at Birchover serves midday and evening meals whilst sand- wiches are available at the Red Lion. A cafe opened in 1984 at the former Post Office in Elton.
